intro: Elatostema medogense var. oblongum, commonly known as the Tibetan Elatostema, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing a compact growth habit. Its leaves are often covered with fine hairs, which may serve as a protective adaptation to the harsh climate. This variant is distinguished by its elongated leaf shape compared to other varieties within the species.
